ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Dr. Ferando and Mr. Webley stimulate my critical thinking in this course. They help develop my writing skill but also encouraged me to speak in classes by throwing a lot of worth discussions.

I learned a lot about the subject matter in this course, including the fundamental ideas, theories, and real-world applications. I also enhanced my research and communication talents and analytical and critical thinking abilities.
This course was great for gaining theoretical and contextual knowledge of classicism. I feel I learned a great deal about the phenomenon and its impact on art history.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course's merits include its well-organized content, interesting learning resources, and the instructor's concise explanations. Assignments and tests were tough and pertinent.

I think the course was overall very well executed. I would only have wished for more discussion about the weekly assignments the week before each was due to clarify any confusion, but generally, everything was put together nicely.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would like to recommend this course to other students from UofT. Since I am not a Yale student, this is a good experience of a summer course for me. Different classes and thinking way really excited me.

Yes, I would advise a different student to take this course. It gives students a strong grounding in the topic, insightful perspectives, and useful skills. Despite its slight flaws, the overall course is valuable and educational for anybody interested in this topic.

I would. The course was on a really fun and exciting topic. Dr. Ferando was super accommodating to everyone's interests, and the course was interactive and discussion based. It was accessible to all students regardless of their background in the field.
Yes, but maybe not alongside a full-time internship like I did. It was more time-intensive than I anticipated.
Yes! Excellent material and Dean Ferando was a great instructor.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
comments: Strongly Agree
Strongly Agree

narratives.question_text: How will you use the knowledge and skills you learned in this course in your future endeavors?
comments: The coverage of this course is comprehensive. Not like some of the art history courses I took before, which only limited me to knowing about the fact of history. Since in this course, I learned about how to apply the history of classicism to interpretative contemporary arts, I can use this skill of critical thinking in future classes.

The information and abilities I pick up from this course will be very helpful in my future endeavours. I want to use my job to solve issues in the real world and make wise judgements by using my knowledge of the subject area. The ability to think critically and analyse problems will help me approach problems methodically, and my enhanced communication skills will help me persuade colleagues and clients of my views in an effective manner.

As an art history major, the theories and approaches to art historical analysis were probably some of the most interesting I have learned thus far. I hope to explore some of the ideas we learned about in class in my own research in the future.
